name: Microtel Inn & Suites by Wyndham Philadelphia Airport

reviews.text: The room was filthy and smelled moldy. Loud. Thin walls so you could hear neighbors. Only nice thing was the shuttle bus driver was very friendly.
reviews.title: Worst place ever. Don't stay here!!!

reviews.text: I didn't sleep all night because the dirty and smelly room had me freaked out.
reviews.title: NEVER, NEVER AGAIN!

reviews.text: I would like to preface this review by saying that I travel around the world for work so my exposure to living conditions is vast. Due to a late arrival, I only had time to check-in, drop bags off and dash out. I returned to my room in the early morning hours, exhausted and ready to sleep. There were so many bugs in the room. Some dead, some living. They were on the beds and all flat surfaces. I called the front desk to request another room. The man there said that he couldn't help me. I asked for a refund. Again I was told that he couldn't help me. He went on to say that I'd have to wait for a manager to come in. I went downstairs to talk to him only to find him with his feet propped up on the counter, singing at the top of his lungs. I wondered about his sobriety. When I began to speak to him, he laughed at me and accused me of bringing the bugs in. Really??? He went on to say that his computer showed my room was complimentary so no refund was warranted. Really??? Refund or no refund, I wasn't willing to stay there another minute. Upon calling the next morning, I spoke with a woman who assured me that a refund would be given but I have no resolution as yet. When I say never, I mean never again! My mistake was to have not read the reviews.
reviews.title: Terrible and dirty

reviews.text: This hotel is dirty. There were cigarette burns on the sheets. I was afraid to go to sleep, I was concerned about bugs. The manager was kind of creepy too. There are much nicer hotels nearby for just a few more dollars.
reviews.title: Looks good on the outside, bait & switch on the inside

reviews.text: I asked to see a room & if all rooms were in this good of shape. Mgr. said yes. I was going to stay for 6 weeks so, I returned a few days & booked 1 week at a time. There were stains everywhere, holes in the linens, ashes in the ice bucket , filthy carpet, what a mess. It was late , I stayed the night called the desk & told them I am leaving in the morning & I better get my refund. I did! Hotel looks good from outside but, obviously I was taken . Not all rooms are renovated. Disgusting room, & in the morning maids were arguing. Poor housekeeping, poor standards. I moved to Mt. Laurel, New Jersey, Candlewood Suites & it is very nice for the same price.
reviews.title: Very friendly to extremely impatient

reviews.text: I had never stayed at a MicroTel before and never will again. The male front desk clerk never acknowledge me and was too busy telling his co-worker how much he was stressed. He left leaving me to wait until his female co-worker could help me. She was very friendly and pleasant to deal with. The room was unbelievably bad. It was so very small, of poor quality and designed without the traveler in mind.
reviews.title: How Bad Can It Get!

reviews.text: The internet was down the first 3 days of our visit. Once it was up it was great. The house keeping staff didn't always empty the garbage.
reviews.title: Good price ... but some issues

reviews.text: Basic hotel,not well kept, Rickety (possible safety issue) stairwell. Poor, poor breakfast. Cereal, juice from powder mix, bagels,coffee....that's it. No Internet, management claimed Verizon at fault because they had failed to repair the service, which had already taken a week. No coffee maker in room. No amenities in room. Poor housekeeping, we found a dirty towel behind the door of the bathroom upon arrival. Senior staff member possibly manager was openly verbally abusive in front of customer to staff member, which should have never happened. We won't be back.
reviews.title: Poor breakfast, no Internet, poor management.......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're landing into Philly late at night and leaving first thing in the morning, then this place is fine.
reviews.title: Serves a purpose

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If however, you have more time, then i wouldn't go anywhere near the place!
reviews.title: Value for Money but Location too far!

reviews.text: Cons
reviews.title: Bedbugs and Lazy Manager

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. The continental breakfast was lacking
reviews.title: WORST HOTEL EVER

reviews.text: 2. No one ever made my bed though I was there nearly a week
reviews.title: been to hotels all over the world, this one is BY FAR THE DIRTIEST AND WORST HOTEL IVE BEEN TO

reviews.text: 3. The manager, an ill tempered Indian fellow, was the worst employee - he never knew where anything was and he was slow to react when we told him our room had...
reviews.title: Bed bugs

reviews.text: 4. Bedbugs
reviews.title: never seen such such stupidity

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a little run-down, but it has free parking which is a plus. The queen suite is relatively big but has limited pillows, the bed is rock hard and the lighting is terrible and the rooms feel cheap. The bathrooms are dated. But, I guess if you're just at the hotel for an overnight at the airport, it serves its purpose.
reviews.title: Not terrible

reviews.text: The room and hallway carpets were old and dirty.
reviews.title: not worth the money

reviews.text: The breakfast area was messy.
reviews.title: Convenient and Affordable

reviews.text: WiFi not working at all.
reviews.title: Awful

reviews.text: bathrooms with hair and dust bunny's everywhere you turn.
reviews.title: This hotel was average

aka: Microtel Inn & Suites Philadelphia Airport Hotel Philadelphia
